alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 09 at 1:33PM MST until December 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5000 feet. Total snow between 2 and 8 inches will be possible, with localized amounts between 8 and 12 inches possible on the North Rim and the top of the San Francisco Peaks. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Seligman, Valle, and Williams. * WHEN...From Sunday night through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Snow forecast from 11 PM Sunday to 5 PM Monday: Doney Park 2 to 4 inches Flagstaff 6 to 8 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 6 to 8 inches North Rim 8 to 10 inches Prescott 1 to 3 inches Prescott Valley 0 to 1 inches Seligman 1 to 2 inches Valle 3 to 5 inches Williams 6 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
